alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 1:27PM MDT until further notice by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cheyenne WY has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wyoming... North Platte River at Saratoga affecting Carbon County. .Snowmelt is driving rises on the North Platte River this week. Any additional rainfall may add to the rises. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...River rises through Action stage and to near Flood stage by the end of the week are possible. * WHERE...North Platte River at Saratoga. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Flood stage. Low lying areas in the Deer Haven RV Park just north of Saratoga begin to be impacted by flood waters. Water approaches low lying areas of homes along the river in town. Water enters low lying areas of Veterans Island Park. River rises may result in erosion along river banks. This may create unstable surfaces near river edges through the next week. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM MDT Monday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be approached by the end of the week on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to river rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM MDT.
